result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian K. Porter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Fine and costs payable as follows:  $50.00 per month, starting on or before October 1, 2016 and on the same day each month therafter, until paid in full.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.  $15.00 payment plan fee added.
Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian K. Porter

defendant.name: Porter, Brian K.
defendant.address: W8847 Decorah Rd, Black River Falls, WI 54615

records.addlTxt: Notice of Intent to Certify Debt to WDOR returned "Retun to Sender Not Deliverable as Addressed Unable to Forward"

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person and with Attorney Poss.  Plead no contest to count 2.  Non domestic DC.  Count 1 dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Joint recommendation for fine.  Court recited the charge and possible penalties on the count he plead to.   Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of disorderly conduct, contrary to 947.01(1).  Joint recommendation of $50.00 fine, plus costs.  Court ordered:  $50.00 plus costs.  DNA surcharge and sample.  Pay @ $75/mo starting 10/1.    Failure to pay any part of the fine or court costs in full by the due date will result in 1 day jail for each $25 left unpaid.
STC canceled and set for PLEAS at request of Atty Poss this date.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

Pre-trial conference on August 10, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Status conference on August 29, 2016 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant shall not consume any alcohol unless a physician states in writing that the defendant is alcohol dependent and complete withdrawal could endanger the defendant's health or life. In this case a doctor's excuse must be submitted to the Jackson County Clerk of Court or the Jackson County Jail within 48 hours of the bond being signed. Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, bar areas of restaurants, or where available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.    As a condition of your release, you must be available 24 hours per day, 7 days a week to submit to testing for alcohol when requested by a law enforcement officer or your probation agent. The defendant may submit to an alcohol test at the Jackson County Sheriff's Office or submit to a PBT by a law enforcement officer. Upon request, the defendant shall appear for and submit to testing within two (2) hours of the official's request.

ADA Melissa Inlow appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, with Attorney Poss, specially.  Reading of the complaint waived.  Defendant stood mute.  NGP entered by court.  PTC set for 8/10 and STC 8/29.
